subject: Writing
title: Writing Goes Electric
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Writing Goes Electric.

hook.text: IBM's Selectric typewriter had no moving carriage. Instead, a spinning ball danced across the page.

buildup.text: Electric typewriters replaced manual effort with motors, making typing faster and less tiring.

discovery.text: The IBM Selectric, launched in 1961, let users swap font balls â€” changing typefaces in seconds.

climax.text: The delete key did what no pen or typewriter could: it made mistakes disappear completely.

punchline.text: Electricity taught writing to forgive mistakes.
